      • isIOS

        public static boolean isAndroid()

      • getDeviceOS

        public static java.lang.String getDeviceOS()

      • startApp

        public static void startApp(java.util.List<App> apps,
                            boolean removeAppBefore)
                     throws AppNotFoundException
        Start a mobile application for testing, automatically determined by the device platform.
        Parameters:
        apps - a list of Apps for each platform that will be parsed when starting the app. The app for the current platform will be chosen.
        removeAppBefore - determines whether app data will be cleared before the app starts.
        Throws:
        AppNotFoundException - when the provided platform is not recognized.

      • startApp

        public static void startApp(java.lang.String filePath,
                            java.lang.String appId,
                            boolean removeAppBefore)
        Start a mobile application for testing.
        Parameters:
        filePath - absolute path to the .app, .ipa, or .apk file containing the application.
        appId - application bundle identifier/package name. Used when uninstalling an app. Can be null if not uninstalling the app before or after the test.
        removeAppBefore - determines whether app data will be cleared before the app starts.

      • stopApp

        public static void stopApp()
        Stops the application, leaving the state intact.

      • stopApp

        public static void stopApp(boolean uninstallApp)
        Stops the application, optionally uninstalling the app
        Parameters:
        uninstallApp - indicate whether the app should be removed after it is stopped. NOTE: On iOS, the app will not be removed, but its data will be cleared.
